Śaka year 897. This is the snaḥ of the men who offered fields at that time:
the prince pu lyaṅ Śrī Jayasiṅhavarman,
with prince pu lki Kumāramātya, chief kluñ of the city,
with my lord chief pov ku kluñ Kunurun,
with Satyādhipati,
with lord pov Saṅgrāmacara,
with Sabhādharmmādhikāra,
with lord pov Jayavikrama,
with lord pov Yudhādhikāra,
with my lord pov ku Nyāyādhipati,
with Raṁgyāv Hrey Atāl,
with Atuk, child of lord chief pov kluñ Jrāy,
with Pvah Dat.

These are the fields at the Luvu vihāra. Its limit gauy: the tanaṅgoh starting point? landmark? is the border ? tupen of Pandanus trees. It goes until above the vihāra. From above the vihāra, it goes along the great road. la panuc the main road. It goes until the luvu above lām̃. It goes from there and falls lac until the river of the Luvu vihāra. It closely rai sīr that river back to the border ? tupen of Pandanus trees.

Inside that section ? manāṅ there are no other fields at all besides those fields Kachutra and Ganan, the fields of the Y.P.K. Śrī Hrinaṇḍaliṅgeśvara.
These fields are for becoming transplantations: 393 plots, [and] for pajāk: their contents is one hundred and fifty-one jāk tandoṅ. Also those sowing fields on the side: 390 plots, their contents is 186 jāk tandoṅ.

This is the field Vvair in Tanah Kandaic. Its limits: from the tanaṅgoh formed by the border of Tāc trees?, it goes straight/flat ? maAndap to the East. It goes along the dike shared with the field of the God Varadeveśvara and also until kajec, it falls to the main road. It turns and goes straight/flat to the South until it shares one dike with the field Śihvan Mavera. It closely follows that field going straight/flat to the West back to the border of Tāc. Inside that section ? manāṅ there are no other kachutra fields @@@at all@@@ besides this field and the field that is the field of the Y.P.K. Śrī Hrinaṇḍaliṅgeśvara. The transplantation fields: 69 plots, for pajāk its content is 25 jāk 9 vAbbreviation of an unidentified unit of contents. tandoṅ. Those sowing fields on the side: 18 plots, their contents is 25 jāk tandoṅ.

In the year of the Śaka king 899, day 11 of the waxing fortnight of month 9, Friday. That was the time when po ku kluñ Panilih carried away surak the statue of Śrīpāda Parameśvara pu pov kuv
until/to it reaches/up to the ājñā lyam̃ po ku Ulīk, high king of Pāndar, to offer fields, in the country of Ulīk: the field Carāv starling, blackbird, the field Paliy Anaiḥ small village, the field Vatek and the field Dauk Śirā reside at the top? and the field Janam̃ḥ Avista all janam̃ḥ,
these fields of the Śrīpāda Parameśvara pu pov kuv which by royal favor were already given to the ājñā lyam̃ po ku Śrīmahāsāmanta.
In Atāla, he charged the yām̃ Ājñā lyam̃ po ku Ulik to offer these fields to become the fields of the yām̃ po ku Śrī Hrinaṇḍaliṅgeśvara diga Śri God of Campa.

This is the snaḥ of the noblemen and of the common men who will at that time offer these fields to the Ājñā lyam̃ po ku Ulīk, high king of Ajyam̃ who is the chief of the city from that time, to the po ku kluñ Paniliḥ

In my translation, I normalise words and titles of Sanskrit's origin according to Sanskrit spelling. Many cases involved spelling without final -a of Sanskrit words that end with this letter. In some instances, one notes that the engraver himself was inconsistent, notably in the toponyms - Atāl, also spelled Atāla - kachuta, also spelled kachutra
